intro: Psychotria hollandiae var. pioraensis, commonly known as the Piora Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
